<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/05/new-york-times-hits-digital-milestone?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The New York Times Hits a Milestone
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="The New York Times building in Manhattan " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xOTkwL25ld195b3JrX3RpbWVzX2J1aWxkaW5nLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Getty Images/Johannes Eisele</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Three days without publishing an op-ed that caused a minor earthquake on social media.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Just kidding, it’s even more monumental than that: For the first time in the paper’s history, the NYT’s digital revenue ($189 million) exceeded print revenue ($175 million) last quarter.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Probably should stop calling it “the paper”</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The NYT added 669,000 digital subscribers in Q2, its best quarter for subscription growth ever. It now has 6.5 million total subscriptions across print and digital, with the goal of hitting 10 million by 2025. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bezos would be proud: </strong>The Times is ruthlessly crushing its peers. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Those 669k new subscribers is more than the combined paid online readership of the Boston Globe and the LA Times, </span><span><a href="https://www.ft.com/content/46e07958-02f3-42c4-92f8-c13147c1c87c?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">per the FT</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>And the beatdown is happening on local news’s home turf. According to the </span><span><a href="https://www.cjr.org/analysis/nytimes-subscriptions-local-publishers-compete.php?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Columbia Journalism Review,</a></span><span> the NYT has “more digital subscribers in Dallas-Fort Worth than the Dallas Morning News, more digital subscribers in Seattle than the Seattle Times, more digital subscribers in California than the LA Times or the San Francisco Chronicle.”</span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">How does that happen?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The vast majority of news subscribers only pay for one (1) online subscription, concludes the <a href="https://reutersinstitute.politics.ox.ac.uk/sites/default/files/2019-06/DNR_2019_FINAL_0.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Reuters Institute</a>, and in the U.S., that’s increasingly the Times.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The company’s been able to attract readers through a variety of strategic investments—in high-quality journalism/talent, games and lifestyle offerings, and multimedia products such as podcasts.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Take “The Daily,” the NYT’s weekday morning podcast, for example. On the earnings call yesterday, incoming CEO Meredith Kopit Levien said host Michael Barbaro’s luscious voice greets an audience that’s “</span><span><a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/08/05/media/new-york-times-q2-2020-earnings/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">vastly larger</a></span><span>” than the daily or Sunday paper. It gets more than 3.5 million listeners each day. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>The NYT may be king of the news hill, but the view isn’t all that great. The pandemic has walloped advertising revenue across the media industry, and the Times felt it—ad revenue slid 44% and revenue on the whole declined 7.5%.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INTERNATIONAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/05/beirut-searches-answers-following-massive-explosion?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
“Paris of the Middle East” in Agony
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Wreckage of Beirut after explosion" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xOTkyL3dyZWNrYWdlX29mX2JlaXJ1dF9hZnRlcl9leHBsb3Npb24uanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>ANWAR AMRO/AFP via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Beirut, the capital of Lebanon and onetime jewel of the Middle East, <a href="https://www.npr.org/2020/08/05/899282146/no-words-after-enormous-explosion-rips-beirut-a-search-for-answers?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">is convulsing</a> in the aftermath of Tuesday’s gigantic explosion. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">In a word? Heartbreaking.</strong> At least 135 people have been killed, over 5,000 injured, and more than 300,000 people displaced from their homes. The city’s bustling waterfront neighborhood <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/08/05/world/middleeast/beirut-explosion.html?action=click&module=Top%20Stories&pgtype=Homepage&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">was flattened</a>. Minister of Information Dr. Manal Abdel Samad Najd declared a two-week state of emergency, and rescue workers are struggling to search for survivors with no electricity. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The cause: </strong>2,750 tons of ammonium nitrate, a highly combustible substance, that had been unloaded at Beirut's port from a Russian cargo ship in 2014. The people of Lebanon are demanding answers from leaders as to why such dangerous material wasn’t treated with more caution. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Public records show that Lebanese customs officials wrote to the courts at least six times for help in disposing of the substance...and got no response. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>The outrage rippling through Lebanon reflects not just fury over the explosion, but frustration with decades of government mismanagement.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ How you can help: </strong>Donate to the <a href="https://www.supportlrc.app/donate/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Lebanese Red Cross</a> or this <a href="https://www.justgiving.com/crowdfunding/lebanon-relief?utm_term=PYp7gXzyD&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">crowdfunding campaign</a> from Impact Lebanon. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MARKETS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/05/house-democrats-investigate-circumstances-kodak-loan-announcement?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Surprise Kodak Deal Under Investigation
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="GIF of Jimmy Carrey looking close up at the camera " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/Gpf8A8aX2uWAg/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="GIF of Jimmy Carrey looking close up at the camera " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/Gpf8A8aX2uWAg/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">When people get really rich really quickly it’s natural to get jealous. And then say, “Wait...what?” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Last week, shares of Eastman Kodak (yes, the camera company) popped as much as 1,481% after it secured a government loan to produce coronavirus drug ingredients. House Democrats <a href="https://www.politico.com/news/2020/08/05/democrats-probe-765m-kodak-loan-391882?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">launched an investigation</a> yesterday into the circumstances around that deal. The SEC has also <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/kodak-loan-disclosure-and-stock-surge-under-sec-investigation-11596559126?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">launched its own probe</a>, according to the WSJ.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What smells weird? A few things:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Democratic Sen. Elizabeth Warren </span><span><a href="https://www.warren.senate.gov/imo/media/doc/2020.08.03%20Letter%20to%20SEC%20re%20Kodak%20stock%20trades.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">noted</a></span><span> “unusual trading activity” before the deal was made public, taking aim specifically at stock purchases made by executive chairman Jim Continenza and another board member in June. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The SEC is reportedly looking into Kodak’s disclosure of the news. It sent a media advisory to outlets in Rochester, NY, a day before the public announcement...then asked those outlets to delete the stories. Any small peep about company developments can move markets drastically. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Important note: </strong>These investigations have just kicked off and we don’t know whether they’ll find anything unkosher about the deal. </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We know what you’re thinking, what would a venerable financial institution like Goldman Sachs want with a newsletter journalist? Well, that’s the best part, they’re hiring in lots of areas that are <em>not</em> financial. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Goldman Sachs is seeking people with all types of backgrounds, experiences, interests, and skills</strong>. Basically, they want people who can dream big and who are interested in creating a better future. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As a company dedicated to advancing inclusivity and opportunity, Goldman Sachs knows that culture and teamwork are key. And they want you to be part of that team.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
M&A
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/05/pe-giant-blackstone-buys-majority-stake-ancestrycom?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Did You Know Blackstone’s Great-Great-Uncle Was Portuguese?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Double helixes holding up a green arrow" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xOTk2L2RvdWJsZV9oZWxpeGVzX2hvbGRpbmdfdXBfYV9ncmVlbl9hcnJvdy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, private equity giant Blackstone <a href="https://www.statnews.com/2020/08/05/blackstone-ancestry-dna-acquisition/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">agreed to buy</a> a majority stake in consumer genealogy company Ancestry.com for $4.7 billion. Ancestry was last valued at about $3 billion in 2017. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What’s in it for Blackstone: </strong>Ancestry has a plethora of data from its at-home DNA tests, which it hopes to use to create additional health products. When talks began a few months ago, Blackstone's leadership was reportedly thinking that people stuck at home would turn to their family trees for entertainment. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Blackstone boasts an enormous </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-08-05/blackstone-said-to-reach-4-7-billion-deal-to-buy-ancestry-com?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$156 billion</a></span><span> cash pile, which it's recently used to gain footholds in #trending companies like Oatly. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The firm is also pushing deep into the life sciences, investing in cholesterol drugs and diabetes devices. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As for Ancestry, sales have been rolling downhill recently, and in February it had to lay off 100 people, about 6% of its staff. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>For four years, Ancestry has been majority-owned by private equity firm Silver Lake and Singaporean sovereign wealth fund GIC. GIC will reportedly retain about 25%.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HISTORY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/05/us-dropped-atomic-bomb-hiroshima-75-years-ago-today?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
75 Years Since Hiroshima
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Today marks 75 years since the U.S. dropped the world’s first deployed atomic bomb on the Japanese city of Hiroshima. It killed 80,000 people immediately and tens of thousands more in the aftermath. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The U.S. dropped another atomic bomb on Nagasaki three days later, Aug. 9.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>On Aug. 15, Japanese Emperor Hirohito announced his country’s unconditional surrender for WWII. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">75 years later...</strong>global non-proliferation efforts are “in jeopardy,” GZERO Media <a href="https://www.gzeromedia.com/the-graphic-truth-nuclear-weapons-who-has-what?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">writes</a>. Russia and the U.S., which account for 90% of the world’s nuclear arsenal, are modernizing their programs, and the New START Treaty (focused on arms reduction) is teetering on the brink of failure. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xOTk3L251Y2xlYXJfd2VhcG9uc19jaGFydC5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24ifQ==" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="" data-reactroot=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;"><small> <em>GZERO Media</em> </small></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">BTW, they've got the best newsletter on global politics. <a href="https://www.gzeromedia.com/subscribe/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Check it out</a>.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
BREW'S BETS
</h3>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">It's baaack: </strong>The Brew's style blog is hot off the press, and in this edition Brew grammar guru Eliza Carter is teasing out the big differences between similar-sounding words. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/05/brew-style-blog-7-lay-lady-lie" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Don't miss it</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Very on brand:</strong> Countries are best summarized by their corporate income tax schedule description. Don't believe us? <a href="https://twitter.com/LevyAntoine/status/1257574717088772097" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">See for yourself</a>.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Strong back-to-school vibes on this week's <img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/fire_1f525.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""> episodes of <em>Business Casual</em>. <p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Think you know how to fix our current education system or the student loan crisis? style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nMEDIA \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/05/new-york-times-hits-digital-milestone?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nThe New York Times Hits a Milestone\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"The New York Times building in Manhattan \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xOTkwL25ld195b3JrX3RpbWVzX2J1aWxkaW5nLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eGetty Images/Johannes Eisele\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThree days without publishing an op-ed that caused a minor earthquake on social media.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eJust kidding, it’s even more monumental than that: For the first time in the paper’s history, the NYT’s digital revenue ($189 million) exceeded print revenue ($175 million) last quarter.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eProbably should stop calling it “the paper”\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe NYT added 669,000 digital subscribers in Q2, its best quarter for subscription growth ever. It now has 6.5 million total subscriptions across print and digital, with the goal of hitting 10 million by 2025. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBezos would be proud: \u003c/strong\u003eThe Times is ruthlessly crushing its peers. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThose 669k new subscribers is more than the combined paid online readership of the Boston Globe and the LA Times, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/46e07958-02f3-42c4-92f8-c13147c1c87c?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eper the FT\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAnd the beatdown is happening on local news’s home turf. According to the \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cjr.org/analysis/nytimes-subscriptions-local-publishers-compete.php?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eColumbia Journalism Review,\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e the NYT has “more digital subscribers in Dallas-Fort Worth than the Dallas Morning News, more digital subscribers in Seattle than the Seattle Times, more digital subscribers in California than the LA Times or the San Francisco Chronicle.”\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eHow does that happen?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe vast majority of news subscribers only pay for one (1) online subscription, concludes the \u003ca href=\"https://reutersinstitute.politics.ox.ac.uk/sites/default/files/2019-06/DNR_2019_FINAL_0.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eReuters Institute\u003c/a\u003e, and in the U.S., that’s increasingly the Times.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe company’s been able to attract readers through a variety of strategic investments—in high-quality journalism/talent, games and lifestyle offerings, and multimedia products such as podcasts.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eTake “The Daily,” the NYT’s weekday morning podcast, for example. On the earnings call yesterday, incoming CEO Meredith Kopit Levien said host Michael Barbaro’s luscious voice greets an audience that’s “\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/08/05/media/new-york-times-q2-2020-earnings/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003evastly larger\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e” than the daily or Sunday paper. It gets more than 3.5 million listeners each day. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThe NYT may be king of the news hill, but the view isn’t all that great. The pandemic has walloped advertising revenue across the media industry, and the Times felt it—ad revenue slid 44% and revenue on the whole declined 7.5%.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBeirut, the capital of Lebanon and onetime jewel of the Middle East, \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2020/08/05/899282146/no-words-after-enormous-explosion-rips-beirut-a-search-for-answers?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eis convulsing\u003c/a\u003e in the aftermath of Tuesday’s gigantic explosion. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIn a word? Heartbreaking.\u003c/strong\u003e At least 135 people have been killed, over 5,000 injured, and more than 300,000 people displaced from their homes. The city’s bustling waterfront neighborhood \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/08/05/world/middleeast/beirut-explosion.html?action=click\u0026module=Top%20Stories\u0026pgtype=Homepage\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewas flattened\u003c/a\u003e. Minister of Information Dr. Manal Abdel Samad Najd declared a two-week state of emergency, and rescue workers are struggling to search for survivors with no electricity. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe cause: \u003c/strong\u003e2,750 tons of ammonium nitrate, a highly combustible substance, that had been unloaded at Beirut's port from a Russian cargo ship in 2014. The people of Lebanon are demanding answers from leaders as to why such dangerous material wasn’t treated with more caution. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePublic records show that Lebanese customs officials wrote to the courts at least six times for help in disposing of the substance...and got no response. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eThe outrage rippling through Lebanon reflects not just fury over the explosion, but frustration with decades of government mismanagement.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ How you can help: \u003c/strong\u003eDonate to the \u003ca href=\"https://www.supportlrc.app/donate/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eLebanese Red Cross\u003c/a\u003e or this \u003ca width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhen people get really rich really quickly it’s natural to get jealous. And then say, “Wait...what?” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLast week, shares of Eastman Kodak (yes, the camera company) popped as much as 1,481% after it secured a government loan to produce coronavirus drug ingredients. House Democrats \u003ca href=\"https://www.politico.com/news/2020/08/05/democrats-probe-765m-kodak-loan-391882?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elaunched an investigation\u003c/a\u003e yesterday into the circumstances around that deal. The SEC has also \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/kodak-loan-disclosure-and-stock-surge-under-sec-investigation-11596559126?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elaunched its own probe\u003c/a\u003e, according to the WSJ.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhat smells weird? A few things:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eDemocratic Sen. Elizabeth Warren \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.warren.senate.gov/imo/media/doc/2020.08.03%20Letter%20to%20SEC%20re%20Kodak%20stock%20trades.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enoted\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e “unusual trading activity” before the deal was made public, taking aim specifically at stock purchases made by executive chairman Jim Continenza and another board member in June. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe SEC is reportedly looking into Kodak’s disclosure of the news. It sent a media advisory to outlets in Rochester, NY, a day before the public announcement...then asked those outlets to delete the stories. Any small peep about company developments can move markets drastically. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eImportant note: \u003c/strong\u003eThese investigations have just kicked off and we don’t know whether they’ll find anything unkosher about the deal. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, private equity giant Blackstone \u003ca href=\"https://www.statnews.com/2020/08/05/blackstone-ancestry-dna-acquisition/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eagreed to buy\u003c/a\u003e a majority stake in consumer genealogy company Ancestry.com for $4.7 billion. Ancestry was last valued at about $3 billion in 2017. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat’s in it for Blackstone: \u003c/strong\u003eAncestry has a plethora of data from its at-home DNA tests, which it hopes to use to create additional health products. When talks began a few months ago, Blackstone's leadership was reportedly thinking that people stuck at home would turn to their family trees for entertainment. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eBlackstone boasts an enormous \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-08-05/blackstone-said-to-reach-4-7-billion-deal-to-buy-ancestry-com?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$156 billion\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e cash pile, which it's recently used to gain footholds in #trending companies like Oatly. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe firm is also pushing deep into the life sciences, investing in cholesterol drugs and diabetes devices. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs for Ancestry, sales have been rolling downhill recently, and in February it had to lay off 100 people, about 6% of its staff. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eFor four years, Ancestry has been majority-owned by private equity firm Silver Lake and Singaporean sovereign wealth fund GIC. style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eToday marks 75 years since the U.S. dropped the world’s first deployed atomic bomb on the Japanese city of Hiroshima. It killed 80,000 people immediately and tens of thousands more in the aftermath. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe U.S. dropped another atomic bomb on Nagasaki three days later, Aug. 9.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOn Aug. 15, Japanese Emperor Hirohito announced his country’s unconditional surrender for WWII. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e75 years later...\u003c/strong\u003eglobal non-proliferation efforts are “in jeopardy,” GZERO Media \u003ca href=\"https://www.gzeromedia.com/the-graphic-truth-nuclear-weapons-who-has-what?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewrites\u003c/a\u003e. Russia and the U.S., which account for 90% of the world’s nuclear arsenal, are modernizing their programs, and the New START Treaty (focused on arms reduction) is teetering on the brink of failure. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cimg
